title: 1997 Bolivarian Games
text:
The XIII <a href="Bolivarian%20Games">Bolivarian Games</a> (Spanish: "Juegos Bolivarianos") were a <a href="multi-sport%20event">multi-sport event</a> held between October 17–26, 1997, in <a href="Arequipa">Arequipa</a>, <a href="Peru">Peru</a>. The Games were organized by the Bolivarian Sports Organization (<a href="ODEBO">ODEBO</a>).
The opening ceremony that took place on October 17, 1997, at the <a href="Estadio%20Monumental%20Virgen%20de%20Chapi">Estadio Monumental de la Universidad Nacional San Agustín</a> in <a href="Arequipa">Arequipa</a>, <a href="Peru">Perú</a>. The Games were officially opened by Peruvian president <a href="Alberto%20Fujimori">Alberto Fujimori</a>. Torch lighter was 70-year-old former cyclist <a href="Hern%C3%A1n%20Llerena">Hernán Llerena</a>, who won 4 gold medals at the <a href="1947%E2%80%9348%20Bolivarian%20Games">1947–48 Bolivarian Games</a> and another gold medal at the <a href="1951%20Bolivarian%20Games">1951 Bolivarian Games</a>.
Gold medal winners from Ecuador were published by the <a href="Ecuadorian%20National%20Olympic%20Committee">Comité Olímpico Ecuatoriano</a>.
